  proposition: Giriprasad Sridhara, Ranjani H. G., and Sourav Mazumdar published a research paper in 2023.

  proposition: Xiaoshuai Song and colleagues developed CS-Bench, a comprehensive benchmark for large language models in computer science mastery.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    CS-Bench|TYPE|Benchmark
    CS-Bench|FOCUS|Computer Science Mastery

    entity-entity relationships:
    Xiaoshuai Song|DEVELOPED|CS-Bench

  proposition: Jason Holmes and team evaluated large language models on the specialized topic of radiation oncology physics.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Jason Holmes|EVALUATED|Large Language Models
    Radiation Oncology Physics|DOMAIN|Evaluation

    entity-entity relationships:

  proposition: Jamil Samaan and colleagues assessed the accuracy of ChatGPT's responses to questions about bariatric surgery.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    ChatGPT|EVALUATED_IN|Bariatric Surgery
    Jamil Samaan|ASSESSED|ChatGPT Accuracy

    entity-entity relationships:

  proposition: Aidan Gilson and researchers investigated ChatGPT's performance on the United States Medical Licensing Examination.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    ChatGPT|EVALUATED_IN|United States Medical Licensing Examination
    Aidan Gilson|INVESTIGATED|ChatGPT Performance

    entity-entity relationships:

  proposition: Tiffany H. Kung and team examined ChatGPT's performance on USMLE and its potential for AI-assisted medical education.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    ChatGPT|EVALUATED_IN|USMLE
    ChatGPT|POTENTIAL|AI-Assisted Medical Education
    Tiffany H. Kung|EXAMINED|ChatGPT Performance

    entity-entity relationships:

  proposition: Zhuo Wang and researchers explored whether LLMs like GPT-4 can outperform traditional AI tools in dementia diagnosis.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    GPT-4|COMPARED_WITH|Traditional AI Tools
    Dementia Diagnosis|DOMAIN|Performance Evaluation
    Zhuo Wang|EXPLORED|LLM Performance

    entity-entity relationships:

  proposition: Adi Lahat and colleagues evaluated large language models in identifying top research questions in gastroenterology.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Large Language Models|EVALUATED_IN|Gastroenterology Research Questions
    Adi Lahat|EVALUATED|Large Language Models

    entity-entity relationships:

  proposition: Jiaju Lin and team developed AgentSims, an open-source sandbox for large language model evaluation.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    AgentSims|TYPE|Research Platform
    AgentSims|ACCESS|Open-Source
    AgentSims|PURPOSE|Large Language Model Evaluation

    entity-entity relationships:
    Jiaju Lin|DEVELOPED|AgentSims

  proposition: Yujia Qin and researchers created ToolLLM to help large language models master over 16,000 real-world APIs.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    ToolLLM|PURPOSE|API Mastery
    ToolLLM|SCOPE|16,000 Real-World APIs

    entity-entity relationships:
    Yujia Qin|CREATED|ToolLLM

  proposition: Minghao Li and colleagues developed API-Bank, a comprehensive benchmark for tool-augmented LLMs.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    API-Bank|TYPE|Benchmark
    API-Bank|FOCUS|Tool-Augmented LLMs

    entity-entity relationships:
    Minghao Li|DEVELOPED|API-Bank

  proposition: Liang Xu and team created SuperCLUE, a comprehensive Chinese large language model benchmark.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    SuperCLUE|TYPE|Benchmark
    SuperCLUE|LANGUAGE|Chinese
    SuperCLUE|FOCUS|Large Language Models

    entity-entity relationships:
    Liang Xu|CREATED|SuperCLUE

  proposition: Haonan Li and researchers developed CMMLU for measuring massive multitask language understanding in Chinese.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    CMMLU|TYPE|Benchmark
    CMMLU|LANGUAGE|Chinese
    CMMLU|PURPOSE|Massive Multitask Language Understanding

    entity-entity relationships:
    Haonan Li|DEVELOPED|CMMLU

  proposition: Viet Dac Lai and colleagues conducted a comprehensive evaluation of large language models in multilingual learning.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Large Language Models|EVALUATED_IN|Multilingual Learning
    Viet Dac Lai|CONDUCTED|Comprehensive Evaluation

    entity-entity relationships:

  proposition: Kaijie Zhu and team proposed Dyval, a graph-informed dynamic evaluation method for large language models.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Dyval|TYPE|Research Method
    Dyval|APPROACH|Graph-Informed Dynamic Evaluation
    Dyval|TARGET|Large Language Models

    entity-entity relationships:
    Kaijie Zhu|PROPOSED|Dyval
